alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Scotts Bluff, southwestern Morrill and Banner Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 642 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Harrisburg, or 19 miles south of Scottsbluff, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Bayard, Terrytown, Minatare, Wildcat Hills State Recreation Area, Chimney Rock State Park, Wildcat Hills Campground, Scotts Bluff National Monument, Harrisburg, Moomaws Corner, Scottsbluff Airport, Redington, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62, South Bayard Junction, Melbeta and McGrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
